put.description:
Update (merge or replace) existing dataset data. This function currently does not support deleting rows.
If replace is true, entire existing dataset data is replaced with the new data in input.
If replace is false,
  • If keys are not given, the input data is appened to the existing dataset.
  • If keys are given then the following flow explains the operation
    For each row in the input data:
    • The rows with same values for all the keys are replaced with input row.
    • Other rows are appended to the existing dataset
    Error raised when:
    • If there are duplicate rows in input data with same key values
    • If any key passed in keys is not present as a column in the input data
NOTE: This directly updates the dataset and all drafts are removed.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the dataset
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the dataset

parameters.name: replace

schema.description: If set to true, replace the existing data with new data
schema.title: Replace

parameters.description: If set to true, replace the existing data with new data

parameters.name: keys

schema.description: Array of keys to match for updating rows
schema.title: Keys

parameters.description: Array of keys to match for updating rows

schema.description: List of dictionaries to replace/merge with existing data
schema.title: Data

delete.description:
Delete dataset rows matching the input data
    All the rows in existing dataset that match all the keys in input data are deleted.
    NOTE: This directly updates the dataset and all drafts are removed.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the dataset
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the dataset

parameters.name: keys

schema.description: Array of keys to match for updating rows
schema.title: Keys

parameters.description: Array of keys to match for updating rows

schema.description: List of dictionaries to replace/merge with existing data
schema.title: Data
